article.headline: W. Carolina 74, Elon 58
article.story: ELON, N.C. -- Mike Williams scored 20 points and Western Carolina never trailed in a 74-58 win over Elon on Wednesday night, sweeping the season series. The Catamounts (10-13, 6-5 Southern Conference), who came in having lost three of their last four games, also defeated the Phoenix 70-63 on Jan. 13. Elon (10-13, 4-8), which has lost three in a row, shot a season-low 29.8 percent from the floor (17 of 57) while Western Carolina shot 48.3 percent (29 of 60). Ranked fourth in the nation with 9.5 made 3-pointers a game, the Phoenix hit only 4 of 25. Elon closed to 45-38 with 14:02 left, then the Catamounts went on a 10-0 run. Western Carolina outrebounded Elon 47-34 and outscored the Phoenix 36-18 in the paint. Richie Gordon had 17 points and 10 rebounds for Western Carolina. Elon's Lucas Troutman posted career highs with 23 points, nine rebounds and four blocks.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
